Text: The important thing is \n letting everyone know \n about the Scarabs.
As long as he's happy \n and makes the front \n page.
Too bad. Guess things \n sometimes don't work \n out.
I'm looking forward to \n the article, wonder how \n people will react...
Ah well, who cares who \n gets credit for what.
The award went to the \n reporter who exposed us.
Hey, reporter guy! \n How'd the Scarab \n story turn out?
I'm sorry all that work \n went to waste.
It got me on the \n front page!
I was even nominated \n for an award.
An award! Did you win?
Well, no. You see, there \n was another reporter who \n took a picture of us...
The fact that all of it \n was staged came out, \n and, well...
If he wants "dramatic," I guess I better get in close.
Oh, it's that \n newspaper reporter!
Hey! What story are you \n working on now? Any hot \n scoops for your paper?
Actually... I'm no \n longer a reporter with \n the paper.

You know how it is 
 inside a big 
 organization. I needed 
 to spread my wings.
So I went freelance.
When you say "spread \n your wings," do you mean \n you got fired?
Well, that's another way \n of putting it! But it \n all worked out.

My pen seeks justice! No 
 matter the danger, I 
 will expose the most 
 dangerous of evils.
Uhuh, and what's \n the evil?
The Scarabs, of course!
This town is under \n threat from a Scarab \n menace.

I need a dramatic 
 picture of the Scarabs 
 to show everyone how 
 much danger we're in.
And you're going to risk \n life and limb to get \n that picture.

Oh... I was hoping 
 you'd be the one 
 risking life and 
 limb.
My weapon is my pen. \n If my writing hand were \n to be injured...
I kinda saw where this \n was going the moment \n we started talking...
Get Close for a \n Picture of the Scarab
I just need to get as close as possible...
I need that picture.
I can't just leave a Scarab walking around!
Shoot, I needed the Scarab for the picture.
I'll just try to get close and grab a picture.
That Scarab's not in the shot!
Perfect picture!
Maybe I'll try getting a picture of it without its shell?
Destroy the Scarab's Shell \n Then Take a Picture
I'll try getting a picture from another angle.
Get a Picture of the \n Scarab from a Different Angle
I need to get closer if I want a dramatic picture.
I'm way too far away, there's no drama here.
I got too close!
I have to break its shell...
I need to get a picture from another angle.
It's too dangerous to leave it, I better take it down.
Defeat the Scarab
Better get the pictures back to the reporter.
Return to the Reporter
Take a Dramatic Picture \n of the Scarab
The Scarab's not in the picture.
Defeat the Scarabs
This is my lucky day! \n That Scarab showed up at \n the perfect time.
Get your camera ready! \n We need a picture!
Guess it's at least \n "lucky" no one else \n is around.
Time to snap a dramatic \n picture of that Scarab.
Yes, and make sure \n there's plenty of \n drama in it!
Check this out!
One Scarab? Kind of \n lacks drama, don't you \n think?
There was only one \n Scarab to take a picture \n of, what do you expect?

If only there were more, 
 we could snap the 
 greatest picture of all 
 time!
Oh well, there aren't, \n so I guess we can call \n it a day- Wait!?
Now's your chance! \n Snap a picture!
Don't you think we \n should do something to \n stop them first?
Just take the picture, \n then stop them!
Come on, you don't \n want to miss the shutter \n chance of a lifetime.
Hmm, not quite.
Not quite what? Don't \n you think it's dramatic \n enough?
Not without someone \n under threat to convey \n the menace.

I'm not going to stand 
 around taking a 
 picture when someone 
 needs help!

It's for the greater 
 good! We need to show 
 the world what's 
 happening.
Unbelievable! And what \n if that person gets \n hurt?
I'm done helping.
W-Wait! A- Aaagh!
Huh!?
AAAGH!
Hold on, \n I'll take 'em down.
No, leave me to the \n Scarabs!
What!?
Take a picture of me \n running for my life!
I need this picture, \n no matter what!
Wow, I didn't know \n he had it in him...
Wait, you need a picture \n of someone getting \n attacked, right?
Then how about \n a picture of me \n getting attacked?
Hurry up and hide!
Your sacrifice won't be \n in vain, I promise!
Got the picture! \n It's overflowing \n with drama!
Now to take care \n of these Nevi.

The horror! The 
 suspense! This picture 
 is destined for the 
 front page.
For years, I've been \n waiting for my chance.
The first time, I was \n stopped from glory by a \n cover-up.
The second time, I \n pursued a false lead.

But now, everything is 
 coming to fruition. The 
 world shall know my 
 name!
Uh, I think I \n helped a bit...
Of course. \n Great picture, \n isn't it!?
I can't just sit \n around!
I need to write this up \n and deliver the story!
The name's spelled \n K-A-T, okay?
More than one Scarab, eh?
I have to take out those Scarabs.
Shoot, I destroyed it.
The Scarabs aren't in the shot!
I'm way too far away, there's no drama here.
I got too close!
I've only got one Scarab in the shot.
Got the picture!
I did it!
I've only got one Scarab in the shot.
Hmm, only got two Scarabs in the shot.
It's too dangerous to leave 'em, I better take them down.
Okay, time to get these pictures over to the reporter.
Take a Picture with 2 Scarabs
I need to get both Scarabs in the frame...
I need to grab a picture of two Scarabs.
I need to grab a picture with four Scarabs.
I need to get both Scarabs in the frame...
I need to get all four Scarabs in the frame...
There are more of 'em now, maybe I can get four in one shot?

Three down, one to go!
I got one in the shot, but not the other.
Maybe I can use the tripod?
Use the Tripod to Take a Picture \n While Getting Attacked by Scarabs
I need to take a picture of them attacking me.
I need to take out the Scarabs.
I should use my camera's tripod.
Shoot, I destroyed it.
The Scarabs aren't in the shot!
I'm the only one in the shot.
I'm way too far away, there's no drama here.
I got too close!
I got the picture!
The Scarabs weren't attacking.
I'm not in the picture!
Okay, I'm about done being a Scarab punching bag.
Mission accomplished!
Reporter: \n Thank you!
Got 'em!
I got a little off track.
I need to get back to the reporter.
